posts.author: MonkeyBusinessDM
posts.content:
The way I understand the rules for options, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for options are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how options works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about options. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with options that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
